intro: Hieracium penzesii, commonly known as the Penzes' hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. It produces small, yellowish flower heads that are surrounded by pale green ray florets. Hieracium penzesii is often found in meadows and open slopes, where it plays a role in maintaining local biodiversity.
